posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Greetings all.
Updated this build idea.

Dropped Str from 18(40) to 16(38) to give it other features.

Sorc to 8, gave it Sorc lvl 4 sorc spells, and Craft Wand so this Dwarven Sorceress can make a wand of Improved Invisibility, Stoneskin or ILMS.
On a server where you can "relevel" you can get all three if you wish.
Base AB of 43 and Str 38 (Dev Crit DC 44-50), base 500hp, DR 15/-. 
Nearly 200 skill points so this sorceress can have detection maxed out against sneakers, some trap setting in the early game.

posts.author: Mick Dagger
posts.content:
This build is in a way hilarious.
Imagine this dwarven lass, four feet tall with her beard in neat braids. Her newly aquired robe of Vecna around her broad shoulders, forming a long train when she walks. Strapped across her back is a blade with a length almost twice her height.
This unlikely dwarf has a very weak constitution, almost sickly for one of her kin.
She is charismatic for a dwarf and even has magic in her blood, but only a tiny little bit.
But she is strong as a giant.

It looks far better once she embraces her inner dragon.

posts.author: Orion
posts.content:
Yes she transforms from a 4hp sorceress into a 500hp Str 40 dwarven devastator :)

Kind of like the beautiful duckling who transforms into the devastating Hulk



That aside, it doesn't look Stagmeister has caught the bait.

(... the bait of making Stag play a pure sorceress for 5 levels)


9 Clever Ways to Help the Medicine Go Down

I tried 3. Disguise the taste (of playing a spellcaster) but it doesn't seem like it worked


The Stag is too smart, can sense a spellcaster from miles away and is not going to fall for Orion's sneaky tricks today

posts.author: Stagmeister
posts.content:
Damn straight young man! I had some spasms even when constructing the Firewing of Corellon. Maybe there's an allergy involved. But I think pure cussedness is a little more likely.

What I certainly don't fall for is a "Look at the pretty dragon wings! Look at the obdurate might of a Dwarven Defender!" when I can see full well there's broccoli in there somewhere .

Still, I can't fault you for trying! (And you really didn't help yourself by bringing the hat up again.)

Cheers
